page.title: 16COUSLAND SCHOOL-CELEBRATIONS
page.content: AT THE END OF EACH TERM, THE PUPILS OF THE SCHOOL INVITE VILLAGERS AND FRIENDS TO JOIN IN THEIR CELEBRATIONS OF AUTUMN/HARVEST, CHRISTMAS/WINTER, EASTER/SPRING AND SUMMER. IN JUNE 1985, THE SUMMER CELEBRATION HAD THE THEME OF 'HOLIDAYS'. PRIMARY 1,2 AND 3 PUPILS SANG SONGS AND READ POEMS AND STORIES THEY HAD WRITTEN (ABOUT THE SEASIDE). THE PRIMARY 3 RECORDER GROUP PLAYED THE TUNE "THERE'S A HOLE IN MY BUCKET, DEAR LIZA". CHORAL VERSE SPEAKING WAS PERFORMED BY THE PRIMARY 4-7 CLASS. TWO GIRLS PLAYED RECORDER TUNES THEY HAD COMPOSED AND A MARCH WAS PLAYED BY THE PERCUSSION ORCHESTRA. MANY PARENTS AND FRIENDS SAW FIVE PUPILS RECEIVE THEIR GIFT BOOKS AS THEY LEFT FOR SECONDARY SCHOOL. THE SMEATON HOUSE SPORTS TEAM RECEIVED THEIR SHIELD AND MEDALS.
